intro: Dryadella sublata, commonly known as the silverleaf dryadella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Dryadella sublata is typically a low-growing shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
